title: A2A Message Definitions
description: Message and content type definitions for the A2A protocol

Message.description: Represents a single message in the conversation between a user and an agent.

contextId.description: The context ID for this message, used to group related interactions.

extensions.description: The URIs of extensions that are relevant to this message.

kind.description: The type of this object, used as a discriminator. Always 'message' for a Message.

messageId.description: A unique identifier for the message, typically a UUID, generated by the sender.

metadata.description: Optional metadata for extensions. The key is an extension-specific identifier.

parts.description:
An array of content parts that form the message body. A message can be
composed of multiple parts of different types (e.g., text and files).

referenceTaskIds.description: A list of other task IDs that this message references for additional context.

role.description: Identifies the sender of the message. `user` for the client, `agent` for the service.

taskId.description: The ID of the task this message is part of. Can be omitted for the first message of a new task.

Part.description: Represents a part of a message, which can be text, a file, or structured data.

PartBase.description: Base properties common to all message parts.

metadata.description: Optional metadata associated with the part.

TextPart.description: Represents a text segment within parts.

metadata.description: Optional metadata associated with the part.

FilePart.description: Represents a File segment within parts.

file.description: File content either as url or bytes

metadata.description: Optional metadata associated with the part.

DataPart.description: Represents a structured data segment within a message part.

metadata.description: Optional metadata associated with the part.

FileBase.description: Represents the base entity for FileParts

FileWithBytes.description: Define the variant where 'bytes' is present and 'uri' is absent

bytes.description: base64 encoded content of the file

FileWithUri.description: Define the variant where 'uri' is present and 'bytes' is absent
